alert.note: Alert for Pinal (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 20 at 6:41AM MST until August 20 at 8:30AM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 AM MST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of South Central Arizona, including the following county, Pinal. * WHEN...Until 945 AM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 641 AM MST, Doppler radar indicated moderate to locally heavy rainfall. This will cause flooding and elevated flows in area small streams and normally dry washes. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - A broad area of moderate to locally heavy rainfall continued across the advisory area and has resulted in elevated flows in small streams and normally dry washes. This new advisory is an expansion of the previous one issued earlier this morning as rain continued in the area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Oracle, Mammoth, Dudleyville and Aravaipa Canyon Wilderness. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
